comment.author: 44116118@N00
comment._content: Do not know anything about the uniforms but this is a powerful photo with the detail\crop you've selected

comment.author: 33577523@N08
comment._content: Very likely Royal Irish Fusiliers. Their collar badge was a Coronet in silver, worn near the opening in the collar, and a grenade in gold embroidery. As far as I know only one other regiment had two badges on their collar and that was the Seaforth Highlanders.

comment.author: 90124154@N00
comment._content: Compare with this print of the Royal Dublin Fusiliers. Same uniform (in color) same kit, definitely different collar badge.
